intro: Anulocaulis leiosolenus var. lasianthus, commonly known as the silverleaf anulocaulis, is a rare and distinctive member of the Bromeliaceae family. It is characterized by its compact, rosette-forming growth habit and is native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. The plant features narrow, silver-green leaves that are often covered in fine, white hairs, giving it its common name. It produces striking, red-orange flowers that emerge from the center of the rosette. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
